conclusion: The task is to predict which container (D or E) liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into after passing through baffles.
The solution involves analyzing the sequence of images to determine the liquid flow paths.

In the first image, there is a board with colored sticks and markers, points A, B, and C at the top with color-coded tabs, various angled barriers/baffles across the board, and two container-shaped structures at the bottom labeled D and E.
In the second and third images, liquid flow patterns are visible when released from the top points.
Liquid from point A (yellow) flows downward, hits the brown baffle, and gets deflected to the left.
The yellow liquid continues flowing down, encountering other baffles, and ultimately flows into container D (the left/yellow container).
Liquid from point A will flow into container D.
Liquid from point B (teal) flows downward, hits the teal baffle, and is redirected.
Following the teal trail, it flows toward the right side of the board and interacts with the orange flow from point C.
Ultimately, the teal liquid flows into container E (the right/pink container).
Liquid from point B will flow into container E.
Liquid from point C (orange) flows downward, hits a baffle, and gets redirected.
The orange liquid joins with some of the teal liquid and ultimately flows into container E (the right/pink container).
Liquid from point C will flow into container E.
Liquid from point A will flow into container D, and liquid from points B and C will flow into container E.
